intro: Pouteria dolichosperma, commonly known as the long-seeded sapote, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in lowland rainforests. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that develop into elongated fruits. The fruit has a thick, inedible rind and contains a single, starchy, edible seed. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local communities.
